CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "Willie Whitehead, 2046 Webster Avenue, Flamingo Bar and Restaurant, Wylie Avenue near Chauncey Street: 'I don't care so much for the union...to tell the truth.  That's because the union has done me more harm than good since it first started.  I've had more trouble out of the union else in connection with my work.'"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender Willie Whitehead posed behind moire patterned bar, with round display of bottles including Four Roses, Philadelphia, and Kinsey, and sponge textured walls, in Flamingo Bar and Restaurant
